title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
algorithmDescription: Find length of longest substring without repeating characters using sliding window
detailedDescription: Find length of longest substring without repeating characters. Input: A string. Output: Length of longest substring with all unique characters. Example: 'abcabcbb' → 3 ('abc'). Use sliding window with hash set.
hints: Use hash set to track characters in current window
Expand window by adding characters if not in set
When duplicate found, shrink window from left until duplicate removed
commonMistakes: Not removing characters when shrinking window
solutionApproach: Two pointers: left and right. Expand right, add char to set. If duplicate, shrink from left until duplicate removed. Track max window size (right - left + 1).
testCaseCriteria: Must achieve O(n) time. Should handle all unique characters, all same character, and empty string.
